column1: Your child has pneumonia, which is an infection in the lungs.
They also gave your child medicine to help get rid of the germs that cause pneumonia.
Your child will probably still have some symptoms of pneumonia after leaving the hospital.
- Filling a humidifier with warm water and having your child breathe in the warm mist Do not use steam vaporizers because they can cause burns.
- Your doctor may tell you to give antibiotics to your child.
Your child's coughing helps get rid of mucus from the lungs.
Your doctor or nurse will tell you if it is OK to use acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin) for fever or pain.
